column1: We should be sitting down & working on a reasonable targeted fiscally responsible #COVID relief bill. Republicans have been more than willing to do that. But the Democrats continue to insist upon a multi-trillion dollar bill consisting of a bunch of liberal wish list items. https://t.co/OC2EgJTkPc

Republicans aren’t giving up on targeted #COVID relief but so far Democrats have shown no willingness for compromise. I hope that changes. Republicans will continue to invite our Democrat colleagues to work with us to find a middle ground. https://t.co/ZlJB4wQGVo

Yesterday for the second Monday in a row we received tremendous news about the prospects for a COVID vaccine. Moderna announced its COVID vaccine is over 90% effective – raising the possibility that not one but two COVID vaccines may be available in the very near future.
This is big news for the American people & a critical milestone in the development of a #COVID19 vaccine. Hopeful to see more good news from this trial soon. https://t.co/AmQJkRJjKq

In Aberdeen today with the rest of the SD delegation to mark the expansion of @3M's N95 mask production lines. This equipment will help protect our frontline workers who continue to put their own health at risk to fight #COVID19. Thank you to our health care heroes & to 3M. https://t.co/dXV3F4X03s

Democrats’ attempted delay antics over the last seven-plus days were absurd. After they voted to block COVID relief multiple times & tried to adjourn the Senate entirely Dems suddenly brought up a completely unrealistic “relief” bill to delay the #SCOTUS vote. Pure theatrics. https://t.co/jH2PBJ1jOb

Hard to believe that Senate Democrats just voted AGAIN to block COVID relief. There are Americans who can't feed their families because of the economic side effects of COVID-19 shutdowns yet Democrats still refuse to act unless GOP allows 2.4 trillion in irresponsible spending.

Why haven't we passed more COVID relief? Let’s boil this down because it’s pretty simple. Dems are sabotaging negotiations & holding relief hostage over blue-state bailouts. Pelosi's all-or-nothing negotiating tactics can't work & sadly it’s Americans who'll pay the price. https://t.co/0gwARcWtBE

Republicans have tried for months to pass targeted support for Americans affected by COVID. We've proposed multiple relief bills but Pelosi's demand is hundreds of billions for blue state bailouts or no deal. How can we find common ground when this is how she negotiates? https://t.co/4OfzPBnX8n

Had a great discussion at @USD’s panel on the business implications of COVID-19 & the challenges/opportunities it could present for South Dakota. Thanks to @USDPresident Gestring & Biz School Dean @Venky4 for inviting me to speak & meet some of their impressive students. https://t.co/iECt0PINsI

Nancy Pelosi is holding key COVID aid hostage unless Congress adds trillions more to the national debt.   Targeted COVID relief?  “No.” ❌ Lifeline for small businesses?  “No.” ❌ Airline employee assistance?  “No.” ❌  It’s pretty clear she’s putting politics above policy.
Praying for the continued health of our president and first lady after their #COVID19 diagnosis and for all Americans who have been affected by this awful virus. We’re still in this fight together.

When Republicans saw Dems had left key ag funding out of the CR we demanded it be fixed. It's been a hard year for farmers/ranchers: low commodity prices bad weather difficulties w/ markets and – of course – #COVID. Very glad we were able to get this funding back in the bill. https://t.co/R7BOjrrvyR

During New York’s toughest moments of #COVID19 medical professionals from around the country stepped in to help. Instead of gratitude Gov. Cuomo demanded these workers pay NY's (famously high) income tax while there. https://t.co/JoBiuv1fRE

I couldn’t agree more. @DepSecSteve is an old friend and colleague of mine and one of the best advocates for the American ag community. We spoke just this morning about providing additional relief funding to farmers & ranchers impacted by #COVID19. I thank him for his service. https://t.co/JmzOce4UIy

Good to see this admin supporting American farmers & ranchers. The @USDA announced second round of vital #CFAP $ to help producers hit hard by #COVID19. At the beginning of #COVID19 there was concern over food shortages. We have our f&r to thank for these fears not coming true. https://t.co/yTXi8I7qZa

Senate Dems recently filibustered: ❌ Relief funding for schools ❌ COVID vaccine funding ❌ Stimulus payments to Americans ❌ Police reform Now they’re saying they would eliminate the filibuster.  This situation stretches the meaning of irony – even by Washington standards.

I hope every American understands what's been happening in Congress w/ #COVID relief funding. Republicans have been trying in earnest to pass a bill; we've offered multiple versions & pursued negotiations. Dems intro’d one spending spree bill & adamantly refused to compromise.

Let’s be clear: The Democrats’ current negotiating position is that unless Congress passes their $3 trillion #COVID spending proposal they aren't interested in a deal. That's right Dems think providing Americans with *zero* assistance is better than our targeted bill. https://t.co/C9vC3ViRqL

Here’s a quick update on our latest effort to get vital funding to Americans who are most impacted by the #coronavirus pandemic 👇🏻  We’re focused on areas with the most immediate need: - unemployed Americans - vaccine research - small businesses - testing - students & parents https://t.co/uK68P7IBud

.@SenateGOP’s latest #coronavirus relief bill is another effort by Republicans to try to find common ground on a realistic #COVID19 funding proposal. This week's vote will be an opportunity for Dems to finally take action after showing an unwillingness to negotiate for months.

There have been two consistent themes of the #COVID19 federal response: 1. Dems’ unwillingness to negotiate on any point unless GOP agrees to add trillions to the national debt. 2. Republicans’ efforts to find common ground on a targeted and fiscally responsible COVID relief.
Hanging out with Haven. This may be one of the rare summers I don’t mind seeing come to an end but this COVID grand baby has been a 2020 bright spot. #blessed #LaborDayWeekend https://t.co/qFgqoTz9Bs

1.4 million jobs were added back and unemployment fell lower in August – a pretty good #JobsReport showing improvement in the economy. We still have a ways to go to get back to the stellar economy we had before #COVID19 but this a good progress. https://t.co/s9oSU7pSkN

Thank you to the fantastic folks at Prairie Lakes Healthcare System for taking the time to show me around their facility and update me on the work they are doing to help keep their community healthy. These men and women have been on the frontline of the coronavirus pandemic. https://t.co/Z8rSXyaBv2

It felt great to be back meeting with South Dakotans in person. Thank you to the folks at Avera Queen of Peace Hospital for providing an update on their response to #COVID19. Our health care providers have been the heroes throughout this pandemic. https://t.co/e9J3VHKC2O

The July #JobsReport was better than predicted with 1.8 million jobs added + a lower unemployment rate. After the economy took a big hit during the shutdown we are continuing to work our way back to what was a stellar economy pre-#COVID19. https://t.co/UbO7yYn1XP

Republicans want to pass a coronavirus relief bill & we’re ready to negotiate. But Democrats have to want to come to the table. ‘Our way or the highway’ is not a negotiating position. I hope – I really hope – that Dems will work with us on a bill that can actually become law.

Republicans have offered multiple proposals for the next step of #COVID19 relief yet each time Democrats come back with the same response: "pass the HEROES Act.” 1. This bill won't pass – it’s not targeted & not fiscally responsible 2. This is not how negotiations work.

When Republicans announced our #COVID19 relief bill we knew our version wouldn’t be the final draft & were open to negotiating. But negotiations involve compromise on both sides and Democrats apparently aren’t willing to budge one inch on their $3 trillion+ 100% partisan bill. https://t.co/V1GmjZqJCf

Let’s be clear Dems’ $3 trillion+ #COVID bill will never pass the Senate. It’s not targeted. It’s not fiscally responsible. Republicans have been trying to negotiate in good faith but Dems refuse to work w/ us to find common ground & they continue to push their messaging bill.

There’s only one way we’re going to make progress on the next round of COVID relief: Democrats must come to the table in a serious way. @SenateGOP wants to help but piling an additional $3 TRILLION onto the national debt as Dems have suggested is a totally unserious proposal.

Coronavirus has turned lives upside down. People who are now working remotely in a different state than their office and medical professionals who traveled to help fight #COVID19 should NOT be subject to higher & more complicated tax bills. My proposal 👇🏻 https://t.co/ymA5XcgUXW

SCAM WARNING: If the @SDDOH contacts you about potential #COVID19 exposure they will NEVER ask for credit card info or money. If you are asked for this info or asked to pay anything it is a scam. It's sad to see scammers taking advantage of this crisis.  https://t.co/S2CVEE9DJ6

If Dems want to play a productive role in the next phase of COVID relief we have a good place to start w/ our targeted HEALS Act. The House bill which would cost $3 TRILLION+ is chock-full of liberal agenda items fiscally irresponsible & will not be considered in the Senate. https://t.co/tbnn4ky357

The #HEALSAct announced by @senatemajldr is the result of months of careful evaluation of existing #COVID19 relief efforts. This new targeted relief bill will give support to Americans who truly need it. I’m hopeful we can come to an agreement that reflects these priorities.

Without a doubt we cannot reverse this economic downturn w/o attacking the underlying health care crisis. We must ensure medical workers have resources to treat patients develop treatments & find a vaccine. This continues to be a priority in the next phase of #COVID relief.

I hope that my Senate Democrat colleagues will eventually look beyond their liberal wish list & work with us to build a bipartisan #COVID19 relief package that addresses the real issues Americans are facing. This bill is not an opportunity to sneak through partisan agenda items. https://t.co/D7PHIvFhit

We’ve been closely monitoring the $2.4 trillion in relief funds that have already been allocated to fight #COVID. We’ve held dozens of coronavirus hearings to identify how we can provide targeted & fiscally responsible relief.   Focus of the next phase: kids jobs & health care.

A few of my priorities in this next phase of federal #COVID relief: -More relief for struggling Americans -Funding for impacted farmers & ranchers -Protection from surprise state taxes for #COVID relief & mobile/remote workers -Telehealth -Liability protections for schools & biz

We had a good meeting with @senategop & members of the president’s team where we discussed some of the broad principles of the next round of federal #COVID19 relief for the American people. We are all in agreement that this effort is about kids jobs and health care.

The #COVID19 crisis we’re facing today is different than the one we saw in March & as a result so will be our response. Waiting and evaluating was the right call. While Rs and Ds might have differing priorities for this next phase there is a common-sense solution within reach. https://t.co/TlTQzlrbBr

To protect against #COVID19 our hospitals biz schools & consumers need dependable access to hand sanitizer. I intro'd a bill to help grant certainty to ethanol distillers & other industries that are stepping up to produce hand sanitizer. https://t.co/YpSmHoamdi

Consumers believe in America. They know that our country will come back stronger than ever after #COVID19. Step one for a sustainable recovery needs to be keeping people safe. Remember to wear a mask so we don’t lose ground in this fight. https://t.co/FrUKcqsjni

The effects of #COVID19 have further highlighted how powerful a tool telehealth can be now and in the future. Glad to see the @FCC recognizing the clear advantages of this technology and supplying providers in SD with the tools they need to invest more in #telehealth. https://t.co/rYckpev85t

Medical personnel from across the U.S. traveled to NYC to help fight #COVID19.  Then Gov. Cuomo announced their reward: taxes.  Tax confusion for mobile/remote workers has long called out for a solution. I’ve proposed one. Read my full op-ed in the @WSJ. https://t.co/WA7jwSKRBR

In recent months #China has cracked down on #HongKong’s autonomy tried to cover up its negligent response to #COVID and militarized illegal islands – all while oppressing over 1 million #Uyghur citizens. This law is one step in holding them accountable. https://t.co/xqx7hBVElu

#COVID19 has highlighted for many Americans something South Dakotans have long known: wide-open space is good for the soul (and your savings). I think more Americans are giving consideration to places around the country like South Dakota where we have low taxes & lots of space. https://t.co/pk10ROZVtQ

I urged @USTreasury & @SBAgov to simplify the #PaycheckProtectionProgram forgiveness application for America’s small businesses who have been struggling through#COVID19. The new EZ application will require fewer calculations & less documentation. Glad to see this change happen. https://t.co/4EtOtntZR8

Once again the #USA shows its strength! Our economy and the American people are bouncing back far faster than expected as states safely reopen. There is much further to go to get back to the booming economy we had pre-COVID but these are hopeful signs. https://t.co/wD5J9iSxgQ

This week alone the Senate is hosting 8 committee hearings on #COVID19.  If Dems really wanted to move more relief forward they’d be working with Republicans to develop bipartisan legislation that actually has a chance of passing Congress & being signed into law. They’re not. https://t.co/rLcumNyprJ

The May #JobsReport underscores @SenateGOP’s calls to look closely at already-passed #COVID19 measures before pushing out more relief $$. If Dems had their way we would've already spent $3 TRILLION more. We're mortgaging our kids’ and grandkids’ future. We have to get it right. https://t.co/gPl7CVPCMm

The effects of #COVID19 have further highlighted the advantages of #telehealth. Proud to see South Dakota’s own @AveraHealth acting as an industry leader in this space. Supporting and expanding this technology will continue to be a priority for me. https://t.co/tFmb4CJ49G

Updates to #PPP have just been signed into law. This program & other @SenateGOP-supported COVID relief have been vital to getting our economy through this pandemic. Today’s better-than-expected #JobsReport is a sign that these programs have helped #SmallBiz bounce back faster.
Great meeting with folks from Avera eCARE in Sioux Falls. #COVID19 has highlighted how powerful of a tool telehealth can be to meet our health care needs. https://t.co/uWGXZTKFRB

There’s more work ahead but this is good news & a strong sign that safely reopening states is helping ease #COVID19 economic strain. Our economy was healthy & growing before the pandemic hit — this is an indication that it may bounce back faster than predicted. #JobsReport https://t.co/Ux8TQ7wJRY

It’s disappointing that Democrats are more focused on their left-wing pet projects than addressing the #COVID19 pandemic and its consequences. But that will not stop the Republican-led Senate from moving forward with the business of the American people. https://t.co/sCZCAjFd5X

The @SenateGOP has been busy in DC with: -Cmte oversight on #COVID19 -Key nominations -Critical national security bill +++  What have House Dems been doing? Show up for 24 hours vote on a $3 trillion messaging bill unilaterally change historic voting rules & then leave town. https://t.co/llj7MZTJVL
I’ll be on @keloland with @SenatorRounds & @RepDustyJohnson tonight to answer questions and give an update on the federal government’s #COVID19 response. Tune in 📺 https://t.co/FvZf23wztd

This global pandemic will take a global response but China’s public-facing acts – which it hopes will reverse focus on its initial negligence & mishandling of the #COVID19 outbreak – run counter to China’s suspected hacking to steal vaccine research. https://t.co/2TAC6DgJV4

One more time for @HouseDemocrats in the back: This bill will not pass the Senate.  It shouldn’t pass. Look what’s in it: - Taxpayer $$ for illegal immigrants - Tells states how to handle their elections - 68 mentions of “cannabis”  What does any of that have to do with #COVID19?

Meanwhile House Dem leadership is bringing back members to vote on an 1815-page Dem fantasy bill that would cost an additional $3 TRILLION & is chock-full of left-wing wish-list items unrelated to#COVID19.   How bad is the bill? Even members of their own party are skeptical.

We brought the Senate back to Washington to look at serious items and spent the last two weeks at work: hearing from experts on #COVID19 passing critical national security legislation & monitoring the effectiveness of relief efforts already being implemented.

Chinese disinformation/censorship is not unique to #COVID19. For years communist #China has sought to hide the detention of #Uyghur & other minorities in #Xinjiang. Thanks for leading this effort for human rights & religious freedom @marcorubio. Glad to support. https://t.co/ZPfmRilFDL

Spoke with @hughhewitt about a viable #Phase4 #COVID19 relief bill. I told him that anything that passes the Senate has to be #bipartisan but sadly it’s hard to find any moderate Dem to sit down with because they’re so held hostage to the House agenda. https://t.co/u9r1d51Kla

Was on the air with @hughhewitt this AM. We spoke about House Dems’ massive new spending package that’s really a grab bag of Dem agenda items disguised as #COVID19 relief. As was said it mentions cannabis more times than it mentions jobs. Nobody is taking it seriously.

Republicans will stand firm & pursue liability protections for Americans at the front line of the #COVID response/reopening. This is about protecting doctors hospitals schools mom and pop restaurants – people who are living in fear of being frivolously sued.

Just left a @SenateCommerce hearing on broadband during #COVID19. It’s clear that access to reliable internet services is a key part of what’s kept our society turning during this crisis (i.e. distance learning for students teleworking and essential telehealth services). https://t.co/DtbByoA73G

House Dems unveiled a $3 trillion #COVID19 bill. $3 TRILLION – all borrowed on the backs of our children & grandchildren. We haven’t yet seen all the effects of the $2.4 trillion we already provided. Once that's been fully allocated we will have a better sense if more is needed. https://t.co/Mfbz4bueEQ

House Dems' bill includes tons of non-#COVID19 items. I keep hearing this bill branded as “CARES 2.” They're trying to tie it to GOP’s bipartisan #CARESACT to disguise their bad policy. It’s a stretch to even call this a Phase IV approach since it has no chance of becoming law. https://t.co/eGuXMuDJTu
Democrats are blatantly using the #COVID19 crisis to try to implement their own liberal agenda. https://t.co/GYIaXrgU8T

Governors shouldn't attempt to cash in on American workers who are coming into states to help fight #COVID19. A hefty tax bill isn't the “thank you” our health care workers & first responders deserve. I have a bill to simplify tax issues for these workers. https://t.co/AQubcBsF37

China should be held accountable for under-reporting & lying about #COVID19 in their country.   At a minimum the world should ban the use of Huawei technology. If countries use Chinese tech in their #5G networks China will be able to surveil & spy on people around the world. https://t.co/cLvp7AgrZx

The South Dakota delegation is getting together later today for a call to discuss #COVID19 & answer South Dakotans' questions. You can join the call to ask questions or listen in. Time: 4:20 PM CT Phone number: 877-229-8493 Pin: 115923 @SenatorRounds @RepDustyJohnson

When we think of heroism we think of acts of superhuman courage & self-sacrifice. And in these days of the #COVID pandemic nurses have displayed special courage and quiet heroism as they continue to save lives knowing they are placing their own health in danger. #ThankANurse https://t.co/1jzTnzd2v6

#COVID19 has devastated many of America's #SmallBiz – layoffs soared by 1000% in March. To help save jobs @SenateGOP created the #PaycheckProtectionProgram but PPP isn't the only way we're helping America's small businesses. More in my op-ed: https://t.co/jv0XEcidI4 https://t.co/suoLxv1ELb

We're working to pass protections that require companies to provide Americans w/ more transparency & control over their personal health data during #COVID19. Businesses should be held accountable if they are collecting people’s data without their knowledge or permission. https://t.co/sApCWcmlVJ

👩🏼‍🍳Extra #PPP relief funding passed & signed into law 📞Hosted tele-town hall to hear from South Dakotans 💻Used technology to meet virtually & stay connected ➕more on how I'm working for you during #COVID19  Here’s my modified #WeekInWashingtonWrapUp from Sioux Falls SD 👇🏻 https://t.co/7ftRqmNmaf

Effective and widely available testing is going to be one of the keys to winning the fight against #COVID19. I support investing in additional manufacturing & looking into innovative ways to develop and administer tests across the country ASAP.

TOMORROW I’ll be hosting a LIVE tele-town hall to hear from South Dakotans discuss #COVID19 and answer questions. Click here to participate: https://t.co/WoY4SDboFc  Details 👇🏻 https://t.co/2sRxdDJanQ

Question: What’s one way the world can hold China accountable for its role in spreading the #COVID19 pandemic?   Answer: By keeping Huawei equipment out of the world’s 5G networks.   “There are no easy answers but there are simple answers.” Ronald Reagan

#China has been spreading misinformation about #COVID19 from day one. This should be a wakeup call to the world about how China operates: a complete lack of transparency and censorship of facts. This is going to take an international response to hold them accountable. https://t.co/pFvKHZKM2r

22 million Americans have filed for unemployment since the #CoronavirusOutbreak hit our country. Hopefully this serves as a stark wake-up call for Democrats who are standing in the way of additional funding for a program that’s helping save jobs & keep small businesses open.
The #coronavirus relief passed by the Senate is having a positive effect on our small businesses that are struggling right now. Great to see. https://t.co/unet0YjKJ6

We want people to be able to go back to work.  We want there to be jobs to return to.  We want small businesses to stay up and running and weather the storm.   Those were among the Senate’s goals w/ #COVID relief bills. In just 4 days #PPP saved an estimated 5.7 M jobs. https://t.co/rNOCd9SMor

There is a lot of information out there about #COVID19 and it can be hard to know what info to trust. For up-to-date resources including important @CDCgov guidance check out https://t.co/G2xDflCUwd. https://t.co/NWquv5UzB5

Spoke on the phone w/ Administrator @SBAJovita from @SBAgov about her effort to implement the #CARESAct’s #COVID #smallbiz relief. I emphasized the need to help #smallbiz owners and employees who help support communities across South Dakota.  #PaycheckProtectionProgram
Great idea to help South Dakotans remain connected while normal life patterns are disrupted by #coronavirus. #TogetherWhileApart https://t.co/qqWhs2XOoj

Applications for #SmallBusiness #COVID relief loans open today.  Key info: #PaycheckProtectionProgram loans can be forgiven if used for eligible expenses like paying workers. Details ⬇️ https://t.co/O4UJCw88K8

#COVID19 UPDATE: South Dakota received pallets of supplies this week from the National Strategic Stockpile and will be getting a number of the @AbbottNews rapid testing machines soon. These tools will go a long way in helping our state prepare to fight coronavirus.

#JobsReport confirms #COVID is hitting American workers & small biz hard. Many businesses are shutting down at no fault of their own making it hard to pay workers. #SmallBiz relief loans enacted by Congress are now available. Info👇🏻 https://t.co/PYMsbsaHHZ

Just had a #COVID19Pandemic update call with Dr. Fauci @StevenMnuchin1 and others in the admin. They’re confident that Americans staying at home & #SocialDistancing are having a positive effect. Even if it’s inconvenient your actions will make a difference as we combat #COVID.
Important #COVID19 information 👉🏻https://t.co/4NOQPOnIC7 https://t.co/F7NsDFKou6

Many have been skeptical of China’s lack of transparency surrounding #COVID19 and new reporting confirms their concealment.  Our focus is on our domestic response saving lives & helping American families. Accurate data informs these efforts. https://t.co/azayT0WbTf

Illegal robocallers are trying to take advantage of the coronavirus crisis. But the @FCC is taking important steps (required by my #TRACEDAct) that will help protect consumers from these bad actors now and in the future.
What does the new @SenateGOP #coronavirus relief law mean for YOU? Here are some of the key provisions to help American workers families and small businesses 👇🏻 https://t.co/YDkMMJizZj
As our nation’s health care professionals fight the coronavirus pandemic on the front lines #NationalDoctorDay takes on more meaning this year.   Thank you for all you’re doing to serve our country.
.@POTUS has signed the critically important coronavirus relief bill that Congress passed this week. Glad to see this emergency funding will start to help American workers and small businesses ASAP.
A lot of folks are out of work as a result of the coronavirus outbreak which is why it’s so important we deliver critical relief to the American people as soon as possible. https://t.co/NMy1yRzRPs

The Senate just passed a third #bipartisan COVID19 relief bill. Challenging times require swift & bold action. It’s heartening to see the Senate was able to rise above politics at this time and act in a bipartisan way to provide relief to the American people.
For #SmallBusinesses owners & employees: here are the details of what’s in the emergency coronavirus relief & #stimulusbill for #SmallBiz 👇🏻 https://t.co/DUQAxDNVAG
Proud of @3M and the many South Dakota workers who are stepping up and doing their part to combat #COVID.  https://t.co/ew06Xtd619

Update: COVID relief & stimulus just blocked AGAIN by Dems. Americans around the country are rising to the occasion. It’s time for Congress to do the same. Save politics for another day. We must act now.

Last night was probably one of the saddest days I've seen in my time in the United States Senate.   Our country is in a crisis and the Democrats are still playing a political game. We don't have the luxury of time in this fight against COVID.
Senate Democrats’ political posturing just delayed the next installment of bipartisan coronavirus relief.
Update from the Capitol where we’re finalizing details on the coronavirus relief bill. https://t.co/97AmxQZDgg
All hands on deck.   We’re working together to get necessary help to Americans whose futures are being impacted by #COVID. https://t.co/i06rIOWyTa
We’re taking big steps at the federal level to fight #COVID. 👇🏻 https://t.co/xyaxfgMSWP

While we have some negotiating ahead of us there is a lot of Republican support in the Senate for providing direct relief to Americans in the form of cash payments to ease disruption from #COVID. https://t.co/gaNw7jpjGh

Additional federal #COVID19 relief will be focused on the workers who've been displaced small businesses facing tough times & medical professionals on the frontlines. This will require swift & bold action.  These are extraordinary times and this response reflects that urgency. https://t.co/BnO8oYoJa8

🚨Important update🚨I just announced a proposal to move back the tax filing date this year. With #COVID the last thing on Americans’ minds is filing taxes. This will give taxpayers & accountants relief during the busy season so they can practice safety measures like teleworking.

HEADING TO @POTUS: Bipartisan bill to provide critical relief to the many American workers & biz affected by #COVID. There’s more work ahead of us to address the full economic impact - Senate Republicans are prepared to work until we provide further relief.

I agree. Voting for the House proposal is a first step and the Senate will be moving forward with a third phase of #COVID relief to address the additional issues that small businesses are facing. https://t.co/Ea3OmgqPqb
If you need reassurance that social distancing works read this 👇🏻   The sacrifices Americans are being asked to make now can and will help slow the spread of #COVID. https://t.co/QQlV7JMzHQ

I remain confident that we can pull together as a nation in these trying times – and for that our country will emerge stronger.   Here in Congress we’re working to help American workers families & businesses get through the tough economic consequences of #COVID19.

For small businesses or non-profits affected by #COVID please visit the SBA coronavirus website (link⬇️) for more details on the Economic Injury Disaster Loan Program that can help you through this hard time. More work ahead of us on this critical issue. https://t.co/sk2Sbdqf6J

Some of the measures being implemented to combat #COVID may be inconvenient but they’re a small price to pay to flatten the curve and limit the disease’s spread. Let’s do everything we can to protect our fellow Americans and prevent hospitals from being overwhelmed with cases. https://t.co/xxTzlSwGsi

Coronavirus cases in South Dakota remain low. Everyone should continue to follow guidance from the @CDCgov to help prevent spread – practice social distancing wash your hands use disinfectant. https://t.co/AoxqiPdgZd

Coronavirus is at the top of nearly every American’s mind – including here in Congress. This week @SenateGOP met with @POTUS @VP Dr. Fauci & other admin officials for a #COVID19 update. While we address the outbreak there's still other work to be done. #WeekinWashingtonWrapUp https://t.co/9oLBDH0LHa

Senators will be in Washington next week working to address pressing issues like the coronavirus outbreak. It is our responsibility to work together to ensure that our country has the resources it needs to combat and defeat this disease. https://t.co/qheXBp6GwY
Thanks for helping to keep South Dakotans informed on #COVID19. https://t.co/JFsaGlQTE8

Telehealth is a powerful tool in helping to protect health care professionals and patients as we combat coronavirus. I’m proud to see @AveraHealth in Sioux Falls playing a big part. https://t.co/EXTP37w3KY

Last week the federal gov worked together to get a law through to fund our medical response to #Coronavirus and ensure professionals have the resources they need to properly deal with the impact. https://t.co/cUOzVNAM9e
My full statement on presumptive #coronavirus cases in South Dakota ⬇ https://t.co/coX8Ga3fAV

My staff and I are working closely w/ the governor and her team and I would encourage South Dakotans looking for more information about #COVIDー19 to visit https://t.co/sM9AmmCZHv or https://t.co/EkevjlAh0A and be aware of any state or local updates in the coming days and weeks.

At the federal level I’m laser-focused on ensuring state and local governments around the country have the resources they need to fight the coronavirus outbreak and last week I was proud to support bipartisan legislation that significantly invests in this fight.
.@GovKristiNoem notified me earlier this afternoon that multiple presumptive cases of coronavirus have been identified in South Dakota.

#COVID has hit at least 34 states & D.C. As more people are tested we expect those numbers to grow.   While the health risks to the average American remain low we should all do our part to protect the most vulnerable in our communities & take CDC recommendations very seriously.

Just received another update on the admin’s response to #COVID19. Like most Americans I'm closely watching the #CoronavirusOutbreak in our country.   The Senate House & admin’s primary concern right now is the health & wellbeing of those who might be affected.

Some of the best precautions we can take to prevent #coronavirus transmission to Americans who are most at risk from #COVID19 are the simplest: -Wash hands regularly. -Avoid touching your face. -Stay home when sick.  We can all do our part.  More info: https://t.co/sM9AmmUB65

Just passed Senate: bipartisan funding bill to help the USA combat the spread of #COVID19. Like many Americans the Senate is closely watching the outbreak. This funding will help medical professionals get the tools they need to address #coronavirus.

Lawmakers share Americans’ desire for urgency in addressing the coronavirus. Bipartisan negotiations are underway on how Congress can help bolster the administration’s efforts. We must be careful not to politicize this. It is not about Democrats vs. Republicans. #Covid_19 https://t.co/Qz0biTIS1g

As Americans learn more about the coronavirus I want to assure them that I’m confident we’ll be able to pass a bill to help give medical professionals the tools they need to address the threat. We are one nation and we can work together to combat this outbreak. #Covid_19

.@VP Pence called me earlier today to discuss #Coronavirus. Appreciate his outreach to leaders on both sides of the aisle. We’re working together –  GOP & Dems Congress & admin House & Senate – to combat #COVID19.
